de.htw.berlin.polysun4diac.forte.comm

Interface IForteSocket

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommFunctionBlockLayer, ForteDataBufferLayer

    public interface IForteSocket
    Interface for communication between a Java application and IEC 61499 communication service interface function blocks (CSIFBs) running on 4diac-RTE (FORTE).

    An IForteSocket can perform the following conversions between JAVA objects and IEC 61499 data types:

    JAVA object/primitive IEC 61499 data type
    boolean BOOL
    int SINT, INT, DINT, USINT, UINT, UDINT
    long LINT, ULINT
    float REAL
    double LREAL
    DateAndTime*, LocalDateTime DATE_AND_TIME
    String STRING**

    *DateAndTime is part of this library.

    Author:
    Marc Jakobi

    HTW Berlin

    July 2017
    See Also:
    ForteDataType, DateAndTime, IPluginController

    • Method Detail

      • array

        byte[] array()
        This method is intended to allow array-backed buffers to be passed to native code more efficiently. Modifications to this buffer's content will cause the returned array's content to be modified, and vice versa.
        Returns:
        the array that backs this buffer  (optional operation).

      • getTypeAtNextPosition

        ForteDataType getTypeAtNextPosition()
        Returns Intended for enabling the dynamic retrieval of data from the buffer. Throws an exception if position is out of bounds.
        Returns:
        a ForteDataType enumeration representing the FORTE data type at the next position.

      • getTypeAtPosition

        Parameters:
        position -
        Returns:
        a ForteDataType enumeration representing the FORTE data type at the specified position.

        true if Position was successfully incremented, false otherwise

      • recvData

        void recvData()
       throws java.io.IOException,
              UnsupportedForteDataTypeException
        Translates byte data representing FORTE data types buffered within the internal DataInputStream to Java data types and stores the Java data types in a buffer. reset() is called after completing the write operation. Before calling this method, a data input layer must be set using #setInputLayer(AbstractCommunicationLayer).
        Parameters:
        iStream - DataInputStrem connected to a FORTE CLIENT or SERVER function block
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        UnsupportedForteDataTypeException

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the position to its initialized state and clears the internal byte buffer.

      • rewind

        void rewind()
        Resets the position to its initialized state.

      • setDateAndTimeReference

        void setDateAndTimeReference(DateAndTime dt)
        Sets a DateAndTime object as reference for any new DateAndTime objects received.

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(int position)
        Sets the position. The position is limited to [-1, getNumDataValues()]. -1 is the initialized state.
        Parameters:
        position -

      • sendData

        void sendData()
       throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the data stored within this instance's byte buffer to a DataOutputStream. reset() is called after completing the write operation. Before calling this method, the data output layer must be set using #setOutputLayer(AbstractCommunicationLayer).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • sendRsp

        void sendRsp()
      throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a response (a single byte with the value of 5
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the connection.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        true if the socket is connected, false otherwise.
